Class used to represent the Chat's thread, a thread class extension.
CheckType
Enumeration that defines the type of check that must be done on CommonGoal pattern.
Choice
This class represents an object Choice that permits the Player to implements actions during the running of the Game which he is participating.

This class represents the command that permits to choose the number of the Player.
Client
This interface provides a general presentation of the client's methods that are implemented in the ClientImpl.
ClientGameState
Enums the class used to keep track of the UI state during the game.
ClientImpl
This class indicates the client's implementation.
ClientSkeleton
This class represents the Client's skeleton, it is necessary for the correct functioning of the Server It contains for pinging the client, updating the model view, receiving exceptions, ...
CommandQueue
Utility class used for all operations related to running/setting the active Player commands as represented in a default queue commands.
CommandReader
Utility class used for managing the Player input for CLI/GUI implementation.
CommandToClient
This class represents the command's archetype.
CommandToServer
This interface extends the Serializable interface.
CommandType
Enumeration of all the possible types of commands/exceptions.
CommonGoal
This class is used to represent the common goal cards that are split between the active Players in the lobby, when the Game is created.
CommonGoalView
This class represents the CommonGoal's view.
ConsecutiveTilesPatternGoal
This class is used to represent those objects that contains the number of Tiles that must be consecutive for making a point considering the pattern of the goal.
ConsecutiveTilesPatternGoalView
This class represents the View of the ConsecutiveTilesPatternGoal.
ControllerState
This Class is used to describe the State Pattern employed in the implementation of the GameController.
Coordinates
This class is used to represents the coordinates of different elements which are used in the model, such as Tiles, ...
CountdownHandler
This class is used to handle the countdown occurring when there is only one player remaining connected to the current's game.
CreationState
This class is referred to the first state assumed by the Game as soon as instantiated.
DiagonalEqualPattern
Class to represent the goal pattern with all the Tiles disposed diagonally.
DiagonalEqualPatternGoalView
This class represents the View of the DiagonalEqualPattern.
Direction
Enumeration that defines the type of direction that must be considered while checking onn a CommonGoal pattern.
DisconnectPlayerCommand
This class represents the command that enables Player's disconnection.
DuplicateNicknameException
This class represents the DuplicateNicknameException.
EightShapelessPatternGoal
Class to represent the goal pattern with eight Tiles disposed in a shapeless form on the Board .
EightShapelessPatternGoalView
This class represents the View of the EightShapelessPatternGoal.
ExceptionType
Enumerates the game defined exceptions.
ExcessOfPlayersException
This class represents the exception occurring when there is a number of player exceeding the game's set numberOfPLayers.
FinalSceneController
The controller used to manage the GUI's final scene.
FinishingState
This class is an extension of the ControllerState, built following the state pattern in order to distinguish through the different possible states of the Game.
FourCornersPatternGoal
Class to represent the goal pattern with all Tiles disposed at the four corners of the Board .
FourCornersPatternGoalView
This class represents the View of the FourCornersPatternGoal.
Game
The class Game represents an object Game that permits to keep tracking and updating the model through a series of methods and a listener linked to the class itself, GameListener.
GameController
This class implements the ViewListener, representing the actual GameController.
GameListener
An interface used to represent an object of type 'listener'.
GameModelDeserializer
This class represents the Deserializer used to enact the game model's deserialization.
GameState
An enumeration of the possible states of the Game.
GameView
This class represents the Game's view.
GenericException
This class is used to represent the GENERIC {code ExceptionType}.
GenericUILogic
The class used to represent a generic User Interface (UI).
GraphicalUI
This class contains the GUI's methods.
InPauseState
Class used to represent the paused game state.
InsertUserInputCommand
This class represents the command that enables user's input insertion.
JsonBoardPattern
The json record used to represent the pattern of the Board, depending on the number of Players.
LobbyIsFullException
This class represents the exception occurring when the current's game lobby is considered as full and some other player tries to join it.
LoginController
This class contains a series of methods used to set and to modify the primary scenes of the main gui.
MainSceneController
The controller associated with the GUI's main scene and employed in its management.
Message
A record that permits the implementation of the serialization of the different types of messages.
MessageType
An enumeration of the possible types of Messages that the Player may send: BROADCAST, for messages readable by all other players or PRIVATE, for those sent to another specific chosen active Player.
MinEqualsTilesPattern
Class to represent the goal pattern with all Tiles disposed in the following pattern on the Board.

An interface used to represent an object of type 'listener'.
OnGoingState
This class is an extension of the ControllerState, built following the state pattern in order to distinguish through the different possible states of the Game.
OptionsValues
Enumeration used to identify all a series of personal goals , tiles, common goals and players related values.

This class represents the Player's personal goal.

This class represents the command that enables registration of the Player.

This command allow to restore the games that have been previously saved.

This class represents a ScoreTile.
ScoreTileView

SendAreThereStoredGamesForPlayerCommand
This class is used to provide methods to verify if there are stored games for the given player.
SendBroadcastMessageCommand
This class represents the command of the broadcast message transmission.
SendExceptionCommand
This class represents the command that allows to notify about an occurred exception during the normal development of the Game to the various Players' Clients.
SendPingToClientCommand
This class represents the command that allows to ping the Player's Client.
SendPingToServerCommand
This class represents the command that permits to send a ping to the Server.
SendPrivateMessageCommand
This class represents the command of the private message transmission.
SendUpdatedModelCommand
This class represents the command that allows to transmit the updated model to the Players' Clients.
Server
This interface represents the Game's server.
ServerImpl
This class indicates the server's implementation.
ServerStub
This class identifies the functioning of the server's stub, it is necessary fo the Client's correct functioning.
SingleClientHandler
This class depicts the handler used for the management of a specific client.

StairPatternGoalView
This class represents the View of the StairPatternGoal.

This class represents the command that enables the Game's startup.
TextualUI
This class represents the TextualUI, an extension of the Game's UI that contains methods used to react to the player's interactions in the CLI textual format.
ThPrintCountdown
This class manage the printing of the countdown on the TUI, if a game goes on pause.
Tile
This class represents the Tile and all the necessary methods (getters and setters) used to access and modify its fields (color, id).
TileColor
Enums all the possible colors that the Tile can assume and provides methods to adjust color in CLI and GUI.

This class represents the Tile's view.
TryToResumeGameCommand
This class is used to provides methods to resume the player's game.

Listener class used to notify events from the TUI
UI
This interface has been used to represent a series of common methods used in the various implementations of the User's interface (both textual and graphical).
ViewListener
An interface used to represent an object of type 'listener'.
WrongInputDataException
This class represents the exception occurring when the data received as input present errors of any sort.
